title: Object-Oriented Collaborative Learning for Practical Mathematics Competency Development

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning environment where practicing professionals utilize knowledge objects for mathematical problem-solving

learning_goals: Learners can solve complex practical problems through collaborative activities using shared knowledge objects (e.g., mathematical models, datasets).
Learners can explain the evolutionary characteristics of knowledge objects and describe the process of improving them through peer interaction.

Learners will co-edit math problem-solving processes at least twice weekly using online collaboration tools (Google Docs, Notion, etc.), generating, revising, and sharing over ten knowledge objects (problem-solving methods, concept explanations, etc.) during a six-month course, achieving over 80% peer satisfaction.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
